column2: We seek a high caliber candidate to join the PineBridge Global RFP Team for a    contract of 6 months    to lead the coordination and management of Due Diligence Questionnaires (DDQs) and Requests for Proposals (RFPs) to retain and support the firms business development efforts. This position provides a unique opportunity for someone to work across asset classes (multi-asset, fixed income, equities and alternatives) and investment channels. The candidate will manage projects and work with the firms global base of Subject Matter Experts (SMEs). The ideal candidate will have interest or working knowledge of investment products, a clear and concise writing style, project    management/organizational    skills, strong communication skills and commitment.            Responsibilities:          Project manage and lead coordination of RFPs/DDQs/Client Updates globally      Collaborate with other Global RFP Team members and global SMEs, such as Sales, Portfolio Managers, Product Specialists and Management colleagues who will assist by providing information and data that will facilitate the crafting of RFP/DDQ responses      Customize responses based on client-specific questions and information obtained from SMEs      Build in-depth knowledge of the firm's product offerings across asset classes, platforms, and overall investment capabilities.      Proactively manage and organize RFP responses in the Content Database (RFPIO)      Responsible for production, final execution and internal distribution of drafts and final version of DDQs/RFPs      Commit to improving the efficiency of the RFP process and the quality of our responses      Build an understanding of clients, consultants and prospects differing needs and levels of sophistication, in order to tailor responses to the target audience      Adhere to strict deadlines in a high-energy, fast pace environment with the ability to assess and reprioritize projects based on client needs (internally and externally)              Personal Profile          Interest in working in high paced sales environment, and can stay focused      Strong communication skills, including technical writing and editing      Exhibits problem-solving and analytical skills      Takes accountability and responsibility      Team player with interpersonal skills and has an interest in building internal connections      Exhibits strong listening and probing skills      Personal integrity, strong work ethic and client service oriented      Enthusiastic, adaptable, forward thinking, self-motivated and energetic      Ability to work independently and in collaboration with team members              QUALIFICATIONS:          Technical Profile          Undergraduate degree holder, preferably in business, finance or economics.      4+ years of investment management experience or with RFPs/DDQs/client service      Coverage of traditional and alternatives investments      Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Outlook, Word, Excel, PowerPoint      Candidate should be comfortable working on contractual basis for 6 months

column2: The Regulatory Compliance Associate ensures compliance of complex cross border trade activities using substantial trade compliance regulatory knowledge     In this position, you will take into account country and foreign government regulations to move goods internationally and execute the controls established by the appropriate functional areas               Role & Responsibilities :       Provide legal and regulatory guidance and support on international trade compliance matters, including import/export regulations, sanctions, embargoes, and customs laws.      Monitor changes in trade regulations and policies and assess their impact on the companys operations.      Knowledge of various regulations like BIS, E-waste management, Plastic waste management and relevant region wise regulations.      Liaise with external legal counsel, government agencies, and trade associations on trade compliance matters.      Interpret and communicate regulatory requirements to cross-functional teams to ensure compliance throughout the product lifecycle.      Knowledge of licensing, registration, clearances, and authorization processes.      Investigate and resolve trade compliance issues, including potential violations and incidents.      Expertise in preparation of companys legal documents      Stay informed about industry best practices and emerging trends in trade compliance.      Monitor changes in the regulatory landscape and provide updates on potential impacts to the organization.            Required Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities :       Ability to implement the regulations effectively.      Able to identify and monitor changes to requirements.      Applies several sets of requirements together balancing strategy effectively.      Willingness and ability to gather product knowledge as applicable to role.      Applies standard procedure and learned knowledge to develop compliance solutions within established guidelines - e.g., be able to read the standards and develop options based on product and organizational knowledge.      Meets agreed upon timelines without frequent updates.      Sees constraints early and highlight them to leadership for resolution.      Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and decision-making skills.      Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to effectively collaborate with cross-functional teams.            Education?& Experience :       Bachelors Degree in Law, International Business, Trade Compliance, or related field; advanced degree (e.g., JD, LLM) preferred.      0.5?to 2 years of relevant legal experience.            Perks :       Open Culture working environment.      30 days of holidays (including public).      Health Insurance for you, spouse, and kids up to 25 Lakhs.      Accidental Insurance up to 10 Lakhs.      Life insurance up to 20 Lakhs.

column1: SA / Assistant Manager, Knowledge Management - Law & compliance
column2: Its never been a more exciting time to join Vistra.   At Vistra our purpose is progress. We believe that our clients have the power to change the world and to do great things for global progress, and we exist to remove the friction that comes from the complexity of global business  to help our clients achieve progress without friction.  But progress only happens when people come together and take action. And were absolutely committed to building a culture where our people can do just that.   We have an exciting opportunity for you to join our team as  Assistant Manager, Knowledge Management . Reporting to the  (Manager) , this full-time and permanent position is based in  Mumbai - Vikhroli, India  and offers regional coverage, allowing you to make a significant impact to our  Global Compliance Function  and its growth.  Key responsibilities: Research new countries, entities and requirements in detail and produce/maintain a support database of templates covering Entity setup Corporate laws Employment laws Tax  direct and indirect Foreign exchange regulations Other technical issues Draft technical papers for internal use. Working on collating information for Global sheets for multiple countries Regulatory updates: To analyse the collated data of regulatory updates with respect to the changes vis--vis actions to be taken in terms of the areas of business the clients are spread across. Updation of internal information softwares (KM Portal) and other areas of data base with the regulatory changes across the identified countries. Assimilate statutory changes for impact and produce appropriate communication. Gathering and assimilating trends and issues with regular analysis and reporting on the impact to the business and its clients. Retain data communicated and research articles for group access. Maintain a strong and sustainable contact with Advisory Personnel around our global offices with a continuous flow of technical information and data, as necessary and in accordance with approved procedures, to support client interaction in all areas of service provided by Vistra Answering client queries for the countries and areas handled Maintain accurate and up to date information as required for the countries handled Develop knowledge of local requirements in portfolio countries, document and promote within Vistra Operate within department systems and processes to ensure accuracy and quality targets are met  Key requirements:  Attributes & Skills: Ability to understand and interpret legal/regulatory concepts Good organisation skills Excellent communication skills Attention to detail Good team player Able to work to targets Ability to take ownership and responsibility Relevant experience: 3-4 years experience with CA, CS or legal background Preferably worked in Regulatory research areas  Education/Professional Qualifications:  Required  CA/CS/LLB Computer Skills:  Microsoft office, specifically Outlook, Word, Excel and an ability to work with systems Language:  None, although knowledge of any European languages would be advantageous Company Benefits: At our Vistra GSC office, we believe in putting our employees well-being first! We offer a hybrid working arrangement.  Additionally, we provide attractive insurance benefits, excellent job exposure and career prospects.     If you are excited about working with us, we encourage you to apply or have a confidential chat with one of our Talent Acquisition team members. Our goal is to make this a great place to work where all our people can thrive. We hope you join us on this exciting journey!
column11: Corporate Law, Compliance, Knowledge Management, Research

column2: This is a full-time "hybrid" role at the office of Mr. Bhavya Nain, Ex- Delhi Judicial Services (DJS) for a Legal Content Writer.          The office is currently located in Lajpat Nagar, Delhi, India.          Candidates will be responsible for conducting legal research and writing research materials for the benefit of judicial aspirants as per the directions and curriculum given to them.          Candidates will also be responsible for staying up-to-date on developments in legislation, legal regulations, and case law through research and review of legal documents and publications.          Candidates will be responsible for making course materials and study materials for judicial aspirants in a time-bound manner.          Candidates will also be responsible for making the MCQ database, making question papers, checking answer sheets, and designing courses for the various law exams.          Candidates must follow the guidelines and complete tasks in a time-bound manner as set out by Mr. Bhavya Nain.            Requirements            Experience in the use of legal software such as SCC Online and Manupatra is a must.          Must have flair and proficiency in legal writing.          Must have in-depth knowledge of Indian law and regulations.          Must have excellent verbal and written communication skills.          Preference will be given to those who have experience in giving judicial service examinations.          Preference will be given to those who have previously written law articles for law journals and law magazines.          Ability to work independently as well as in a team in a time-bound manner.          Ability to multitask and take on additional tasks as may be assigned to them.          Freshers may also apply, provided they have a good academic record in law and have the zeal to work.

column2: You are working in contracts, compliances or litigation for the last 2 years but want to work remotely & get more work life balance     You desire strong growth in your career, want to increase your income potential & it is important for you to have a stable salary     You are good at nitpicking and pointing mistakes in a constructive manner, as you appreciate high quality of work         You like to help others improve         You are able to apply your mind to new problems, love to learn new skills to teach others & can take ownership of final outcome     Ready to         work 8 honest hours per day         but do not like back breaking pressure & 14 hour days     You love guiding other young lawyers & helping them to learn hands-on legal skills         You can give objective written feedback to others without judging them     You want your workday to be clearly planned out and do not like to deal with unforeseen adventures         You obtain satisfaction from your work when you see that someone whom you have given feedback to has improved over a period of time - your students success is a huge source of pride         You want to mentor younger lawyers on how to do this     You would enjoy working with a distributed remote team working from different corners of the world, would love to travel & live in different places without compromising with your legal career     You don t need a boss to sit on your head & tell you what to do           This role is       not suitable       for those who do not have       self-discipline       and needs       consistent monitoring   .           What kind of work would you have to do?             Your work day will involve giving feedback on student s submissions and improving their drafting and editing skills. You will be part of their transformation story.             The team you are about to join is a mission driven team training hundreds of talented young lawyers from tier 2 or tier 3 cities to secure international remote work which transform their careers.             Our primary goal is to provide our learners with practical skills through live classes, simulation exercises, feedback sessions             Not only we help them to learn new skills that are in high demand in the market, we also help them to develop a track record through freelance work, publications & content creation that help them to get noticed by clients & recruiters.             We consider ourselves successful only when our learners get success. You will be enabling a new generation of lawyers to emerge from unlikely places, all of us take pride in this.
